name: Puli Kuzhambu
history: Puli Kuzhambu is a traditional tamarind-based curry from Tamil Nadu. This dish is a staple in South Indian households, known for its tangy and spicy flavor profile. It typically features a variety of vegetables and spices.
description: Puli Kuzhambu is a tangy and spicy South Indian curry made with tamarind, a variety of vegetables such as okra, eggplant, and drumsticks, and a rich blend of spices. It's often served with rice and is cherished for its depth of flavor.

instructions.title: Prepare Tamarind Water
instructions.description: Soak the tamarind paste in warm water, extract the juice, and set aside.

instructions.title: Fry the Vegetables
instructions.description: Heat sesame oil in a pan. Add mustard seeds, fenugreek seeds, dried red chilies, and asafoetida. Once the mustard seeds start to splutter, add the vegetables and fry lightly.

instructions.title: Add Tamarind Water and Spices
instructions.description: Pour the tamarind water into the pan. Add sambar powder, curry leaves, and salt. Bring to a boil and then simmer until the vegetables are cooked.

instructions.title: Simmer the Kuzhambu
instructions.description: Reduce the heat and let the kuzhambu simmer until it thickens to a desired consistency.

instructions.title: Serve
instructions.description: Serve the Puli Kuzhambu hot with steamed rice.

tips: Adjust the amount of sambar powder and red chilies to suit your taste preferences.
Simmer the kuzhambu on low heat to enhance the flavors.
variations: Try different vegetables like pumpkin or bitter gourd for a change in flavor.
Add a pinch of jaggery for a hint of sweetness.

storage.shelfLife: Can be refrigerated for up to 3 days.
storage.instructions: Store in an airtight container in the refrigerator.

reheatingInstructions.instruction: Reheat on the stove over medium heat until warm.

presentationTips: Garnish with fresh curry leaves for added aroma.
Serve in a traditional earthenware pot for an authentic South Indian experience.
